thread.title: Bandhan plans to tap MSME business in South India
thread.title_full: Bandhan plans to tap MSME business in South India | Business Standard News

author: BS Reporter
title: Bandhan plans to tap MSME business in South India
text:
Bandhan Bank, the microfinance entity turned universal bank, plans to tap into the micro small and medium enterprises (MSME) for growing its business in South India, a market it will open 100 branches in two years.

The bank will begin with 14 branches in the five southern states, when it is launched on August 23, by President Pranab Mukherjee.  Bandhan, the largest microfinance institution with a market share of 25 percent, currently doesn’t have a presence in South India.

“Micro and small enterprises are not getting access to credit by the existing banks,”said Chandra Shekhar Ghosh, managing director and CEO of Bandhan Bank. “We will implement our learning from microfinance to offer better service to these customers”.
